reviewText: The course is unclear and instructions are not so supportive. And it needs to refer articles of Inc and it has so many ads and at a point it says we have to pay for read articles. Other than that course is simple. And peer review thing is not working well

I took this course hoping to learn some new skills and strategies , but as soon as I got to the section about email introductions I knew this wouldn't be for me. I'm the person who receives emails like this, and every time they follow the pattern mentioned in the course I mark them as spam (because 99% of the time they ARE spam). There's also no real teaching happening? You watch 30 second videos about nothing and then are linked to a bunch of freely available articles for "required" reading.
i try to cancel the course but nothing works.

Useless content besides some tricks and tips, doesn't deliver at all on the promise, the course is called customer segmentation and prospecting but there is no content on how to create market segments, how to approach them, how to generate leads or anything that is at all usefull.Waste of time!
you donr even provide results

Great to listen to, however, hard to take away shared knowledge, information and presented principles for conducting any sales activities or even to begin. Knowledge shared and presented in this course just seems easily delivered, yet hard to receive and learn. The same goes with taking notes.
Would advise against - don't believe the lessons are worth the cost.
OK for junior sales

I feel there is still a lot to discuss here specifically in the qualifying section instead of just mentioning the topic names.To get an idea of how this could be done the course instructor or the editor may take a look at the (Cold Calling Mastery course by Miles Croft on Udemy).The most helpful part of this course was the Gear explanation which did have great value but frankly, I would think twice and probably not consider other courses considering the level of content and explanation.
There are good advices, but it's basic/beginner in knowledge.

I found a lot of the material very insightful and eye opening. Craig does an amazing job of explaining certain ideas and concepts you may have some across before in a way that will impact you far more strongly. I appreciated how much of the course relies on you putting in the effort to truly understand what is being discussed.I think there could be more guidance and stimulation from a moderator in the discussion areas, as they are mainly just used to ask for someone to peer  review your work. I think the peer review system is interesting, but ultimately not that effective. I have found many assignments of people who are just uploading blank documents in the hope to of getting put through easily by someone who works like them. It's a bit uncomfortable and being stuck with having to peer review before you can finish really slows things down at the end.Still, that says nothing about the quality of the content. All of the worksheets and processes are incredible and have already made my ability to contact targets stronger. It has also given me a different, more confident mindset while not losing track of my morals and desires as a person.
Nice course and useful in carrier opportunity

The content was pretty well-crafted. But the evaluation as part of completing the Certification needs to be looked into (which is the reason that I deducted 1 point while rating the course). The problem came with Peer-Evaluation, which took quite a good amount of time & affected my overall experience with the course since the wait to receive the certificate was unbelievably long. This is a Beginner's level course & the assignments were simple enough requiring a candidate to apply just the basics of sales. For such courses that require application of just the base-level skills a simple Quiz could do to ensure timely receipt of the Course Completion Certificate.

Customer Segmentation and Prospecting ¬†is foundation course for The Art of Sales Specialization. This course taught on the knowledge and skills required to succeed as a salesperson, as well as all the skills and disciplines required to be a high performing salesperson. It contains some really wonderful insights of sales function like; What problem we are solving? What is our target market? Who are the customers within that target market and how we will talk to them? Also learnt the various techniques of narrow down target list, writing perfect introductory emails, Identification of Main lead generation source, sales conversion, identify Prospects etc. All these are explained precisely with short videos, Role play and barter technique.   Overall great learning experience to acquire new skill sets and ¬†would like to learn more

Like many people I did not think much about sales... just knew that I am not a person to be selling anything and that was bad... So this course really opened up my skills in being confident and being able to sell myself way better than before. Great tools. It is a difficult year and this course was also a way to hopefully come out better in the next year.The barter to exchange for something better with strangers however was not so easy with travel bans and trying to stay in social bubbles. I did however not just barter, I managed to invent a product (a course), put it online and really sell it and execute it. So I did not start with a pen but with just a poster on social media and upon return earned money (equivalent of a minimum monthly wage, in about half a month). There was a time I used to earn that money in a day being a consultant but this time it was something very new for me. I applied a lot of techniques to achieve this. Thank you! Very practical.

I was looking for a Sales course, this is not my first experience with Coursera. I got some certificates in 2016, to be honest with you I cannot say to be fully satisfied, I decided to give up. After four years, I had a look to some online Sales courses and at the end I decided to enroll to this one by watching a Craig's video. He is the Professor for whole course and the full Specialization, he is magnetic, he allowed me to understand concepts that I was unable to learn by reading books. I want to share my life experience of yesterday, having a drink with a friend of mine, we were at open air and we had a talking to a person close to us. This person introduced himself as a Biotechnologies Professor with experiences spent to international universities, he was just a bit proud of himself. He started talking about history, mainly with my friend and he started complaining with him. I said to me: this is my fish! I just started with a couple of impact questions, only with these I have been able to catch his attention, he turned his face and his whole body towards me. What about the rest? I had an experience like have a remote control in my hands, this is powerful! This is a message for Craig: here you have my personal standing ovation for you!!!I'll be happy to receive your feedback. Alberto :)
